series.title: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
series.author: Michael Ian Black

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #52 David Wain
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Michael talks with his friend for a memorable conversation about his career writing and directing films such as Wet Hot American Summer and They Came Together. Wain opens up about the early days in the improv group The State, and talks about everything from his worst dry spell to now struggling with saying no.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #51 Grace Helbig
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The YouTube star and bestselling author discusses how she stumbled into her successful career making funny videos watched by millions of viewers every week.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #50 Amani Al-Khatahtbeh
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The millennial founder of MuslimGirl.net, the number one online publication for Muslim women in the United States, and the author of the new memoir, Muslim Girl, talks about her experience being a feminist, American Muslim in post 9/11 America.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #49 Andy Cohen
episodes.author: Michael sits down with the charming author, host of Watch What Happens: Live and executive producer of The Real Housewives for a lively discussion.
episodes.summary: Michael sits down with the charming author, host of Watch What Happens: Live and executive producer of The Real Housewives for a lively discussion.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #48 Michael Lewis
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The bestselling author of "The Blind Side," "The Big Short," "Moneyball" and his newest, "The Undoing Project," tells his own great story about growing up in New Orleans and how that shaped his world view and approach to life.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #47 Neil deGrasse Tyson
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The world famous astrophysicist, Director of the Hayden Planetarium, television host, author and all around badass talks to Michael about how his early years opened his mind to the universe and laid the path to his future success.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #46 Ira Glass
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: From NPR intern to the creator, host, and Executive Producer of This American Life, Michael talks to Ira Glass.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #45 Mary Roach
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Michael sits down with the investigative journalist and bestselling author of Grunt, Stiff and Bonk for a humorous and insightful conversation about her unique research and writing process.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: About The Election…
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: A message from Michael about how he's been feeling since Nov 8th.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #44 Sharon Horgan
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The UK creator, writer and star of the BBC hits Pulling and the current Catastrophe (also seen on Amazon), as well as the creator and Executive Producer of the new HBO show Divorce, starring Sarah Jessica Parker, talks about creating her own success.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #43 Al Roker
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: America's favorite weatherman talks to Michael about how he stumbled upon what became the career that he loves.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #42 Daniel Kahneman
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: When Michael spoke to Five Thirty Eight's founder Nate Silver, he highly recommended Daniel Kahneman's groundbreaking book Thinking Fast and Slow. Now, Michael talks to Kahneman, the Nobel Prize-winning author and founder of behavioral economics, in a rare interview.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #41 Sonia Manzano
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Michael talks with Sonia Manzano on the heels of her recent Lifetime Achievement Emmy.  Manzano is best known as “Maria” on Sesame Street, a character she helped create and played for 44 years on the groundbreaking television show.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #40 Penn Jillette
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Legendary magician and raconteur Penn Jillette has a keen eye for calling out the bullshit around him, but it took a dangerous health scare for him to realize his own eating habits were going to kill him if he didn't change.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #39 Harlan Coben
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The best-selling thriller master talks craft with Michael.  A not-to-miss episode for anyone who aspires to write or just wants to know how a big bestseller is put together.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #38 Tim Gunn
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: In this deeply personal and heartfelt conversation the fashion therapist and Project Runway mentor, Tim Gunn, opens up about his struggles with learning to be comfortable in his own skin and using his talent, creativity and passion for the arts to inspire others.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #37 Valerie Plame
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: As a spy, Valerie Plame’s job was for nobody to know her identity.  All that changed when members of George W. Bush’s administration outed her and ruined her life.  Her experience from 2003 is disturbingly relevant to events happening today.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #36 Michael Showalter
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Michael sits down with his friend and fellow member of the comedy troupes The State and Stella for a lively, hilarious and moving conversation about finding your voice in the entertainment industry.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #35 Wayne Pacelle
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: From protesting turkey at Thanksgiving, to making a career helping animals, the President and CEO of the Humane Society talks to Michael about how he attacks the huge problems facing animals today.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #34 Lauren Mayberry
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The lead singer, co-producer and co-writer of the Scottish pop band Chvrches talks to Michael about her journey from being a law school student and journalist in Glasgow to performing in front of thousands of people.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #33 Dan Savage
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Dan Savage's authentic openness and empathy informed from growing up a closeted gay in a Catholic family that might not fully accept him made him realize that nobody should be dismissed because of their sexuality or sexual preferences. No wonder he's America's leading sex advice columnist.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #32 Memorial Day Special: Bryan Doerries
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Bryan Doerries has become responsible for one of the biggest collaborations in history between the U.S. Military and the arts world using greek tragedies to start conversations and a process of healing in communities that are dealing with some of the darkest things that humans have to deal with---  war trauma, imprisonment, and addiction.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #31 Krista Tippett
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Krista Tippett has devoted her professional life to asking the big questions on her show, On Being.  Questions about faith and science and love and how we should live our lives are posed in such an engaging, thought-provoking way that it's no wonder she has amassed a huge following on both public radio and through her popular podcast.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #30 Max Brooks
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: When you grow up the only child of two very famous parents, most people don’t expect much from you, but Max Brooks wanted to prove to himself that he was more than just “Mel Brook’s kid” so he became the bestselling author of "The Zombie Survival Guide" and "World War Z."

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #29 Suzy Favor-Hamilton
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Suzy Favor-Hamilton went from being a three-time Olympian to a high class escort in Vegas.  She tells her story, and how she got control, in this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #28 Jim Gaffigan
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: It took  Jim Gaffigan years to find his own comedic point of view, but today he's one of the most popular comedians working.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #27 Audra McDonald
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Michael talks to the six-time Tony Award-winning actress Audra McDonald about failed auditions, letting go of her idea of perfection, and how she learned to embraces new challenges.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #26 Chuck Klosterman
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: In this episode Klosterman discusses his rise from small town boy to finding his place as one of America’s best loved cultural critics.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #25 John Leguizamo
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: John Leguizamo tells Michael how a Latin boy from Queens was able to carve out his own career in what he calls “Hollywon’t.”

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #24 Naomi Klein
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The best selling author and speaker makes the big subjects like global warming and unfettered capitalism understandable and simple and even offers us a ray of hope in the face of a seemingly dire future.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #23 Dan Harris
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: After years of covering wars oversee, it was reading the news on Good Morning America that nearly did in newsman Dan Harris after he suffered a major panic attack live, on-air.  His search for serenity is the perfect guide for the skeptics among us.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #22 Baratunde Thurston
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The funny, charming and super smart author, comedian, producer and sought after public speaker, Baratunde Thurston.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #21 Felicia Day
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: With the publication of her memoir, “You’re Never Weird On The Internet,” Felicia Day walks Michael through how she made her own success on her terms, and what happens when you get what you want.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #20 David Sedaris Part 2 Family
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: In Part 2 of Michael’s interview with David Sedaris, they talk about growing up Sedaris and how his relationship with his father motivated him to be the writer he is today.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #19 David Sedaris Part 1Money
episodes.author: NPR Humorist and Best-selling Author of “Me Talk Pretty One Day” and “When You Are Engulfed in Flames” talks to Michael about his rise to success
episodes.summary: David Sedaris has become one of America’s pre-eminent humor writers.  In Part 1 of his interview, Michael talks to David about how he crafts his stories and how his career as a writer and performer became so successful.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #18 Alexis Ohanian
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: In his early 20's Alexis Ohanian and his partner Steve Huffman started the popular social media site Reddit.com making him a millionaire at a time most people are barely out of college.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #17 Bobcat Goldthwait
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: At the height of his so-called success being one of the top comedians in the US, Goldthwait chucked it all and decide to focus on writing, directing, and most of all, being happy.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #16 Ingrid Michaelson
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The best-selling recording artist of such hits as "Girls Chase Boys" and "The Way I Am" talks about not saying yes to the established recording industry and forging her own path to success.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #15 A.D. Miles
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Head writer for "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon" discusses everything including the behind-the-scenes of working on one of the most successful television franchises in history.
tags: The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #14 Tom Colicchio
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Superstar chef Tom Colicchio went from flipping grilled cheese in his bare feet at a concession stand to overseeing a restaurant empire.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #13 Chris Hardwick
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: After several years of abusing alcohol and not being able to pay his rent, Chris quit booze, stopped acting and decided to make a world out of the things he’s passionate about which led to a build-it-and-they-will-come multi million-dollar business, Nerdist Industries.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #12 Megan Mullally
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: After barely paying her rent for years trying to make it as an actress, Megan Mullally hit the big time.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #11 Nate Silver
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Nate Silver is a statistical celebrity.  He predicts elections, sports games and even what you had for breakfast.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #10 Frank Rich
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The fascinating life of Frank Rich who's career highlights include Chief Theater Critic for "The New York Times," then becoming their Op-Ed columnist and now being the Executive Producer of one of the best shows on TV, "Veep" with Julia Louis-Dreyfus.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #9 Miranda July
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Award-winning filmmaker, writer and multimedia artist, Miranda July seems to have dreams of conquering the world.  And she just might do it.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #8 Brian Greene
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Theoretical physicist and string theorist, Brian Greene understands some of the world's most difficult mathematical equations and, here's a neat trick, he can explain them and make them fascinating to the rest of us.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #7 Carl Tanner
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Operatic tenor, Carl Tanner, spent years hiding from his voice, first as a truck driver and then bounty hunter until he finally decided to put the guns down and pursue his incredible talent.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #6 Amy Schumer
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Michael sits down with his friend and fellow comedian, Amy Schumer

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #5 Kevin Smith
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Michael takes us into the world of the fascinating, profane, indie movie director, Kevin Smith, who helped change the world of movie-making with his first film, Clerks.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #4 Bob Odenkirk
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Actor, comedian and author Bob Odenkirk talks about his professional journey.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #3 Tavi Gevinson
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Tavi Gevinson is still a teen and runs her own media empire.  No joke.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #2 Lin-Manuel Miranda
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Lin-Manuel Miranda, the the Tony Award winning-lyricist who's musical In the Heights catapulted him on the Broadway scene at a very young age and is now taking his new hit, Hamilton, the hip-hop, pop, rap musical about the Founding Fathers , to Broadway.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: #1 Elizabeth Gilbert
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: The best-selling author of Eat, Pray, Love (among many other great works) Elizabeth Gilbert talks to Michael about creative process - her own and others who have inspired her.

episodes.seriesTitle: How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.title: Welcome to How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
episodes.author: Michael Ian Black
episodes.summary: Amazing people are all around us.  In this new, in-depth interview show from PRX, Michael Ian Black takes us into the minds of some of the most fascinating celebrities, newsmakers and maybe even a few people you’ve never heard of (but should definitely know) to discuss how they became, well, amazing.  (Note: no minds were … Continue reading Welcome to How To Be Amazing with Michael Ian Black
